Serial RT-PCR results in our case highlighted the importance of the clinical specimens sampled from lower respiratory tract for detecting SARS-CoV-2 virus,
8 which is different from the report from Zou L, et al.
9 Additionally, our case demonstrated that throat wash by gargling could be an alternative method for COVID-19 diagnosis, since specimen from lower respiratory tract was barely available at the early stage of infection. Nevertheless, when the patient became afebrile, sputum still outweighed specimens from throat swab or gargling wash.
